page.title: 09Old Dalby Quilters
page.content: In 1983 some women in Old Dalby became interested in quilt making.The group took hedgerow flowers as their theme for a large quilt.They decided to have 12 panels with one for each month of the year.Flowers were sketched and then patterns made for each panel.Each quilter took a panel.Eleven quilters began but a year later when the quilt was finished there were only 7 left. The completed quilt was 240cm.by 243cm.The group decided to raffle the quilt and the money raised was to be shared between Old Dalby Village Hall and the Renal Unit at Leicester.10,000 tickets were printed and in 6 months 9,600 were sold at 25p.each.The winner of the raffle was a patient of the Renal Unit and he gave the quilt back to be raffled again in 1985.The Village Hall and the Renal Unit were each given Â£1,050.
